p: The two NiV strains are responsible for the outbreaks in various geographical areas. Bangladesh and Indian outbreaks have reported the source of the virus to be NiV-B while the Malaysian outbreaks were reported to be from NiV-M [ 49]. Clinical reports have uncovered several differences between NiV-M and NiV-B outbreaks. NiV-B has a shorter incubation period compared to NiV-M [ 40, 46]. The majority of NiV-B cases had respiratory symptoms as well as lethal encephalitis while NiV-M predominantly caused encephalitis with few signs of respiratory diseases [ 1, 2, 51]. In addition, NiV-B infection resulted in a higher mortality rate compared to NiV-M. This difference could be attributed to inadequate regional medical care [ 32, 52]. Nevertheless, it could also be linked to differences in the genetic variations and pathophysiology inherent to each strain.
